comments.commentBody:
"There is a well known study of this policy that shows how well the children from disadvantaged families do when they attend school with kids who aren't poor. And there is no negative impact on the better off kids."
Too bad things didn't turn out that way in other cities.

There's no mystery about America's self-censoring journalists.  We live in an oligarchy. The oligarchs control both the journalists and the politicians. The oligarchs will cease to employ journalists who call their politicians liars.  Simple as that.  Jon Stewart's peerless and enduring legacy will be his ability to brilliantly skewer those screaming to be skewered, practically daring the oligarchs to do something about it.  Journalists take note.  Our nation desperately needs John Oliver, Trevor Noah, Stephen Colbert and others to carry on Jon's courageous legacy.

@Josie: " standards were continually lowered which created the existent problems."
Sounds exclusionary. BTW, the same thing occurred in many urban middle class neighborhoods. Why is it is ok to lower standards in any neighborhood?
Hate him.  Hate his program.  Never watch Fox News.  How about that?

Poverty doesn't "beget people", but it does NOT provide the life choices (nutrition, education, parental attention) that lead OUT of poverty.  Children who are born poor have no less potential or "inherent aptitude" as any wealthy white kid.
ya right like a large percentage of viewers "stream" his show live.
We let it slip away with our selfish interests.  We didn't pay attention.
Thank you! Isn't that what investigative journalists do? Search for the truth? If a senator is saying a bold-faced lie, why can't (s)he be called out on it?
Journalists are no longer thoughtful contributors to our political discourse. They are peddlers of propaganda and sensational gossip, who serve the interests of their corrupt capitalist masters.

“There are a lot of journalists who watch Stewart and envy the freedom he has,” Mr. Greenfield added. “You can’t go on television when you’re a journalist and say, ‘Senator X is a bald-faced liar.’ ”

This reminds me of the ancient tradition of court jesters, who were allowed to humorously criticize kings and queens without getting their heads chopped off. Didn't realize we had regressed all the way back to that system. Our mainstream media are so timidly obsequious that it takes a comedian to speak truth to power. Whatever happened to the land of the free and the home of the brave? What happened to our democracy?

Your position with respect to losing equity is often lost on the good liberals and progressives. In their narrative you have accumulated wealth over generations of privilege.
See how it works?
Political satire and comdey from a white male perspective ... but it's still very good.
Nope. Al Franken was much funnier and more clever when he hosted election night coverage on Comedy Central prior to Stewart's ascension. Gen X humor.....not that funny
Stewart, Colbert, Oliver…political satire and comedy at their best.

I hope so!

Senator Franken and Senator Stewart, speaking the unfunny truth to power and the American people in a very funny way.
Jon will be running for US Senate in NJ. You heard it here first. I've compiled a list of clues.

" 'Social engineering by government knows no end. It hasn’t worked in the past, so what will work this time? Nothing. Crips, Bloods & the Latin Kings will move into the suburbs. Changing one’s ZIP code cannot change the years of mind-set poverty brings with it”'– suggests that the potential for backlash should not be underestimated."
And those things have happened. Generally it's been the lower middle and middle class who have felt the negative impact of public housing in their neighborhoods. They have the most to lose when their housing depreciates because of the increase in crime and violence in their neighborhoods.
I have lived through this experience along with my family and neighbors.
Liberals and progressives just keep whining "who do they vote against their best interests?". The answer is, they aren't.

Yep. Count me among the uncounted viewers. I never had cable, so missed much of the early years, but have watched more since being able to access the show online. Even watching an episode days after it airs, it is still the funniest most truthful version of of our hypocrisy - democracy.
Better than day old bagels!
Thanks Jon!

The fewer people, the lower the costs -- avoid a pregnancy and eliminate a person's expensive journey into existence; let early-onset disease go untreated and cull a few who might later, surviving, sprout financially disastrous tumours.  "The dismal science" indeed.

amydm3:

But first the inspectors have to find them in a country twice the sizes of Texas. Inspectors will be on the lookout for things like new construction, and if they're buried underground, well, their job just got a lot harder.

The IAEA after having been thwarted in North Korea and Syria is eager to try out its "new and improved" inspection regime. Stop and think about that. It will be testing its new procedures out on Iran. No wonder Isreal is concerned.

Nope, no free lunch, but a lot of cost shifting comes from increasing the insured population. The hospitals of choice for the uninsured are generally operating at a loss and subsidized by cities, counties and states, aka tax payers.

Other forms of recovery of roughly $100 billion in uncompensated care are from increased charge master prices which determine rates for employer insurance.

And longer living people do ultimately cost more in the Medicare system, same as in Europe, where total costs are less than half of the US.

Hmmmm...

The next frontier for cost compression is the employer insurance market. This now mandated benefit has become such a huge cost to employers that the nice folks in HR are about to be shoved aside by the flinty eyed financial types. This has already started. It's called "reference pricing", aka "this is what we pay for that procedure", initiated by a few major employers to date. Expect it to tear through the health care business, forcing the kind of tough decisions already made by a lot of other once fat and happy business sectors.

These things happen in the US. Take a look around.
Incapable of participating because of illness, mental or physical, or accident.  Duh, 47 percent.

Let me just analyze your statements:

"There is nothing fresh and nothing new about Trump. "

So Trump, an anti-politically correct presidential contender, who is also a TV personality and accomplished businessman, who runs a multi-billion dollar company, is nothing new? I just want to be sure I understand you correctly, since your logic seems deeply flawed.

You've treated us to a smorgasbord of theory (Game of Throne and all that other nonsense), which isn't backed up by anything factual.

Amen Rodney, how about the government making the businesses that moved out of Chicago and Detroit move those jobs back into America?  When that happens all people will have a job and the we can move up the ladder of success.  Gee I forgot. The government does not run America, BIG BUSINESS does. Americans bail out the banks, banks don't bail out America.
Brilliant assessment; thanks for it!

David Chowes - "the majority of the borough"? not having white skin doesn't mean you live in a slum. you obviously haven't seen the whole borough.

NM - "just more excuses"? only someone with either not too much wisdom or just a hateful heart couldn't understand. If "values" are taught generation to generation - what were those deliberately disenfranchised people going to teach their children??? Does that make sense to you? the old slave masters all the way down to the old "Jim Crow" crew understood it perfectly... that's why they destroyed families and re-enforced negative stereotypes... Basically the same thing you are doing - but in cyber space.
Way too dangerous. Accidents do happen. Trump/Palin would be the end of America.

I think this debate will focus on who is the most irrational, most abrasive ,most brash, who can insult the most. who can be most anti Hillary , most anti health care, most anti women issues, most anti Gay,,
most anti enviorment and above all who hates Obama most. That's their guy
Except for Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren....and maybe Alan Grayson...
And Donald Trump owns the miss America pageant.
The vision of a swimsuit competition sprung into my mind. Ewwww.

I watched some of the TV debates held in the UK during the 60-day campaign cycle of their recent national election. Candidates were peppered with unscripted questions from voters and required to think on their feet and talk knowledgably about the main issues on the table. The voters also appeared well-informed and asked challenging questions, often with follow-ups. The candidates for the most part came across as intelligent people and could answer questions directly. Compared with that, Thursday's Republican "debate" will be more like a Miss America pageant.

You may be right about Megyn Kelly. I've never seen her on TV.

But I do listen to Chris Wallace on C-SPAN reruns of Fox News Sunday and I have to say he is completely fair. He really is - he treats conservatives and liberals very similarly, challenging them fairly strongly.

And this is coming from someone who generally hates Fox and has watched probably no more than 1 full hour (in total) of it since it started. I don't think many of the other hosts are the same, but we should give credit where it is due.
I wonder if Nielsen has ever measured how irrelevant and obsolete they have themselves become?
Me, too. Any many of the people I know. No cable available in my rural area.

Nobody in our family has cable. Nielsen is an outdated rating.

And BIG THANKS to Jon Stewart! We need you!

Never watch this show on TV.
Watch it always online, when it's convenient.

TDS has many more viewers than Nielsen can count.
